subject: Re: [junit] Identify name of the TestCase
msgSnippet: Sorry... I thought it was getName() . Apparently it s name() . Thanks. So said Jason Rogers on 4/14/2003 -------------------- On Mon, 14 Apr 2003 13:56:17
messageBody:
Sorry... I thought it was "getName()". Apparently it's "name()". Thanks.

So said Jason Rogers on 4/14/2003 --------------------
On Mon, 14 Apr 2003 13:56:17 +0200, "Gupta, Vipul"
<Vipul.Gupta@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
>
>
> Hi Friends,
> Need help in identifying the name of the test case in jUnit.
> I am running some tests through the Suite in jUnit and from the
> TestResult I
> want to know the name of the (TestCase)testFunction that was executed.
> Do we
> have anything like this available in jUnit from which we can identify
> the
> TestCase which is being run in the suite.
> TestResult t= new TestResult();
> t = junit.textui.TestRunner.run(tc.doTest());
> Any advice will be highly appreciated.
> Regards
> Vipul Gupta

Use "name()"
--
=jason
